channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: Nvidia‚Äôs AI business can‚Äôt justify a $3 trillion valuation ‚Äî but here‚Äôs what can, says a NYU finance professor.

item.title: Eli Lilly blows past estimates, hikes guidance as Zepbound, Mounjaro sales soar
item.description: The success of Eli Lilly's weight loss and diabetes drugs Zepbound and Mounjaro caused the company to hike its guidance.

item.title: Thousands evacuated, state of emergency declared after Ukraine's raid into Russia
item.description: A state of emergency has been declared in Kursk following a Ukrainian incursion into the Russian border region.

item.title: BP downgraded on concerns over stock buyback ability
item.description: BP saw a broker downgrade on Thursday after analysts said its stock buyback is less sustainable than rival integrated oil companies.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield falls ahead of key unemployment data
item.description: Treasury yields slipped early Thursday, with global stocks on the backfoot again.

item.title: Amazon's $4 billion investment in AI firm Anthropic faces UK merger investigation
item.description: Amazon's multibillion-dollar investment into U.S. artificial intelligence frim Anthropic is formally being investigated by U.K. competition regulators.

item.title: Oil prices edge lower after back-to-back gains
item.description: Oil futures were off slightly early Thursday, consolidating after back-to-back gains.

item.title: Restaurant Brands revenue tops estimates, fueled by Tim Hortons
item.description: Canadian coffee chain Tim Hortons was the restaurant company's strongest performer during the quarter.

item.title: Eli Lilly blows past estimates, hikes guidance as Zepbound, Mounjaro sales soar
item.description: The success of Eli Lilly's weight loss and diabetes drugs Zepbound and Mounjaro caused the company to hike its guidance.

item.title: Harris antitrust policy would prioritize business growth and competition, says Maryland Gov. Wes Moore
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has yet to articulate a position on antitrust in the first two weeks of her campaign against Donald Trump.

item.title: Italy looks like fertile ground for a mega merger deal in banking
item.description: Years after a debt crisis in the region and a government rescue for Banca Monte dei Paschi, analysts are looking at Italy's banking sector with fresh eyes.

item.title: In a stock-market meltdown, this retirement-account trick can save you thousands in taxes
item.description: But too few people know about it, or do it.

item.title: Harris running mate Gov. Tim Walz owns no stocks, bonds or real estate, disclosure shows
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz has a modest financial profile after working as a high school teacher and member of Congress.

item.title: Deliveroo shares jump 8% after posting first-ever profit on 'inflection' in consumer demand
item.description: Deliveroo made a net profit of ¬£1.3 million ($1.7 million) in the six months through June, bouncing from a loss last year.
